required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Performance of Newly Developed 1-piece Ostomy Product Compared With SenSura
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Safety and Performance of Newly Developed 1-piece Ostomy Product Concept Compared With SenSura 1-piece in Subjects With an Ileostomy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the current investigation is to evaluate the combination of an adhesive with a soft top film.

primary_outcome.measure: Leakage (Percentage of All Baseplates With Leakage)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After each baseplate change over a period, of 7 days
primary_outcome.description: leakage is measured using a 4-point leakage scale developed by Coloplast A/S. At every baseplate change the subjects had to look at the skin facing side of the baseplate and access which of the four scenarios described below provided an accurate description of the baseplate. The subjects tick of one of the four possible answers: No leakage Starting to leak (leakage under the baseplate) Leakage (seepage of faeces resulting in leakage on clothes) Sudden leakage (the baseplate pops off resulting in sudden leakage under the baseplate and outside the baseplate)

arm_group.description: The subject in this arm first test the Test product The test product is a newly developed ostomy appliance with a new top film. Due to company confidentiality the product is not described in further details. After cross-over the subject test SenSura which is CE-marked and commerical available.

The subject in this arm first test SenSura which is CE-marked and commerical available. After cross-over the subject test the Test product The test product is a newly developed ostomy appliance with a new top film. Due to company confidentiality the product is not described in further details.

intervention.description: The test product consists of an adhesive with a new top film
SenSura is the CE-marked and commercially available comparator product

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Have given written informed consent
2. Be at least 18 years of age and have full legal capacity
3. Be able to handle the bags themselves
4. Have an ileostomy with a diameter between 15 and 55 mm
5. Have had their ileostomy for at least 3 months
6. Currently use a 1-piece flat ostomy appliance with open bag
7. Use minimum 1 product every second day, i.e. maximum 2 days wear time
8. Be suitable for participation in the study and for using a standard adhesive, flat base plate
9. Must be able and willing to use custom cut products
10. Accept to test two 1-piece products within the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Use irrigation during the study period (flush the intestines with water)
2. Currently receiving or have within the past 2 months received chemotherapy or radiation therapy
3. Currently receiving or have within the past month received systematic steroid or local treatment in the peristomal area
4. Are pregnant or breastfeeding
5. Participating in other interventional clinical investigations or have previously participated in this investigation
6. Currently using a ostomy belt
7. Currently using extended wear product
8. Have a loop ileostomy
9. Known hypersensitivity towards any of the test products
10. Suffering from severe peristomal skin problems prior to participation in the investigation (assessed by the study nurse)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The subjects were recruited from hospital sites in Sweden and in Germany subjects were recruit from the Coloplast database and from hospital sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The investigation was designed as a cross-over study where subjects that did not complete the 1 period as planned were allowed to continue to the next test period.

group.title: First Test Product; Then SenSura
group.description: The subjects tested two products: In the first period the subjects tested the newly developed ostomy bag called Test product. In the second period the subjects tested the comparator SenSura

group.title: First SenSura, Then Test Product
group.description: The subjects tested two products: In the first period the subjects tested the comparator SenSura. In the second period the subjects tested the newly developed ostomy bag called Test product

participants_list.participants: It was uncertain in which order the product were tested for 1 subject. Subject is excl from analysis
It was uncertain in which order the product were tested for 1 subject. Subject is excl from analysis

baseline.population: Three subjects were excluded from the intention to treat (ITT) population. Two of the were inclusion criteria violaters; 1 convex user and 1 colostomist. with the last subject it was uncertain in which order the subject tested the test products. the subejct was excluded from the analysis

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: Describing baseline data for all subjects in the ITT population

outcome.title: Leakage (Percentage of All Baseplates With Leakage)
outcome.description: leakage is measured using a 4-point leakage scale developed by Coloplast A/S. At every baseplate change the subjects had to look at the skin facing side of the baseplate and access which of the four scenarios described below provided an accurate description of the baseplate. The subjects tick of one of the four possible answers: No leakage Starting to leak (leakage under the baseplate) Leakage (seepage of faeces resulting in leakage on clothes) Sudden leakage (the baseplate pops off resulting in sudden leakage under the baseplate and outside the baseplate)
outcome.time_frame: After each baseplate change over a period, of 7 days

group.title: Test Product
group.description: The new test product is a 1-piece open ostomy product with the intended use being collecting output from an ileostomy.

group.title: SenSura
group.description: CE marked and launched SenSura used in this investigation is a 1-piece open appliance with the intended use being to collect output from an ileostomy.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse events were collected for 14 days
reported_events.desc: The subject for whom it was unknown which intervention was recieved did not have any adverse events in the course of the study

group.title: Test Product
group.description: The new test product is a 1-piece open ostomy product with the intended use being collecting output from an ileostomy.

event.sub_title: red skin in the peristomal area

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Camilla Felsvang Vibjerg, Senior Clinical manager
